alert.note: Alert for Southern Middlesex; Southern New London (Connecticut) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Coastal Flood Watch issued January 10 at 7:12PM EST until January 13 at 2:00PM EST by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY MORNING THROUGH SATURDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Potential for 2 to 2 1/2 feet of inundation above ground level possible in vulnerable areas near the waterfront. * WHERE...Southern Middlesex and Southern New London Counties. * WHEN...From Saturday morning through Saturday afternoon. * COASTAL FLOOD IMPACTS...Potential for widespread moderate flooding of vulnerable areas near the waterfront and shoreline, Saturday morning. Potential for 2 to 2 1/2 ft of inundation above ground level in low lying, vulnerable areas. This would result in numerous road closures and cause widespread flooding of low lying property including parking lots, parks, lawns and homes/businesses with basements near the waterfront. Vehicles parked in vulnerable areas near the waterfront would likely become flooded. Flooding will also extend inland from the waterfront along tidal rivers and bays. * SHORELINE IMPACTS...Potential for breaking waves of 3 to 5 ft during the Saturday morning high tide. This would result in beach erosion, and wave splashover onto shoreline roads and properties. * RIVERINE IMPACTS...Freshwater runoff coinciding with the Saturday morning high tide could exacerbate street and property flooding issues along tidal reaches of rivers in southeastern CT. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Timing of windshift of southeasterly gales to southwesterly gales in relation to the time of high tide Saturday morning will be key to water level forecast. This will be refined over the next 48 hours. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. NEW HAVEN HARBOR AT NEW HAVEN CT MLLW CATEGORIES - MINOR 8.7 FT, MODERATE 9.3 FT, MAJOR 10.6 FT MHHW CATEGORIES - MINOR 2.0 FT, MODERATE 2.6 FT, MAJOR 3.9 FT TOTAL TOTAL DEPARTURE DAY/TIME TIDE TIDE FROM NORM WAVES FLOOD FT MLLW FT MHHW FT FT IMPACT -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 10/10 PM 5.7/ 6.2 -1.0/-0.5 0.0/ 0.5 3 NONE 11/11 AM 7.5/ 8.0 0.8/ 1.3 0.4/ 0.9 2 NONE 11/11 PM 5.7/ 6.2 -1.0/-0.5 -0.2/ 0.2 1-2 NONE 12/12 PM 7.5/ 8.0 0.8/ 1.3 0.2/ 0.8 1 NONE 13/12 AM 8.0/ 8.5 1.3/ 1.8 1.7/ 2.2 2-3 NONE 13/12 PM 8.9/ 9.4 2.2/ 2.7 1.7/ 2.2 3 MIN-MOD THAMES RIVER AT NEW LONDON CT MLLW CATEGORIES - MINOR 5.0 FT, MODERATE 6.0 FT, MAJOR 7.8 FT MHHW CATEGORIES - MINOR 1.9 FT, MODERATE 2.9 FT, MAJOR 4.7 FT TOTAL TOTAL DEPARTURE DAY/TIME TIDE TIDE FROM NORM WAVES FLOOD FT MLLW FT MHHW FT FT IMPACT -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 10/08 PM 2.7/ 3.2 -0.5/ 0.0 0.6/ 1.1 5 NONE 11/09 AM 3.7/ 4.2 0.6/ 1.1 0.6/ 1.1 3 NONE 11/09 PM 2.3/ 2.8 -0.8/-0.2 0.2/ 0.7 2 NONE 12/10 AM 3.5/ 4.0 0.4/ 0.9 0.2/ 0.8 1 NONE 12/11 PM 3.6/ 4.1 0.5/ 1.0 1.4/ 1.9 1-3 NONE 13/10 AM 6.0/ 6.5 2.8/ 3.4 2.8/ 3.4 4 MODERATE &&
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property.
